item.title: R to @quantymacro: this book and Grinold & Kahn are probably the two books that everyone says is a “must read” but very little ppl actually read them

item.title:
Idk much abt “Super ratio”, but may I perhaps interest you in something called “Multivariate Linear Regression”? where you have multiple features as inputs & produce a single estimate of exp returns. also pls add ridge penalty.
follow me for more extremely advanced quant tips.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
Idk much abt “Super ratio”, but may I perhaps interest you in something called “Multivariate Linear Regression”? where you have multiple features as inputs & produce a single estimate of exp returns. also pls add ridge penalty.

follow me for more extremely advanced quant tips.

item.title: of course it would mate. you’re hiring for private equity. you can hire them straight out of pre-school and you wouldn’t even notice any difference

item.title:
I’m actually a very soft quant interviewer
> 95% of the qs will be based on what you wrote in CV > don’t ask brainteasers > don’t ask leetcode > don’t ask city you were born in > don’t ask first pet you had > don’t ask mother’s maiden name > don’t ask your name
you’re welcome
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
I’m actually a very soft quant interviewer

> 95% of the qs will be based on what you wrote in CV
> don’t ask brainteasers
> don’t ask leetcode
> don’t ask city you were born in
> don’t ask first pet you had
> don’t ask mother’s maiden name
> don’t ask your name

you’re welcome

item.title:
me when I see that the quant PM who reads my blog has been expanding his team:
(there’s a very high chance he’s using my blog as a contra but it’s ok I’m just a chill guy who likes to write things)

item.title: gf is landing at Heathrow early tmr morning and idw wake up early so I just casually drop some money (big amount) to stay in a hotel near Heathrow tonight. this is the kind of prestigious lifestyle you can only live once you’ve developed quantitative acumen to solve the market.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: chat should I tell my PM that financial markets are fat-tailed and non-linear? never heard him mention any of these words. quite worried he might not be aware of these important findings (understandable of course, few know this). thanks in advance
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description: chat should I tell my PM that financial markets are fat-tailed and non-linear? never heard him mention any of these words. quite worried he might not be aware of these important findings (understandable of course, few know this). thanks in advance

item.title: going into CPI, my signals are positioned for the exact opposite of how the team’s signals are positioned. Mr Negative Correlation never disappoints. lfg
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:

item.title:
on 14th Aug 2024, I had extremely profound thoughts on cross-validation, that warrants an article
normally when I have ideas I would write the outline so I don't forget things. but I didn't, because it was so profound I was sure I won't forget
now I completely forgot abt it
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: R to @quantymacro: and I only know how to scan for keywords — one time I was too embarrassed to google/ask in front of others so I got “prawns ceviche” expecting it to be some banging juicy grilled prawns and ended up being very disappointed. thankfully it was someone’s treat
